fields.name: host
fields.description: ORCID host (base URL) of the ORCID iD.

fields.name: path
fields.description: ORCID path (16-character identifier) of the ORCID iD.

fields.name: uri
fields.description: ORCID iD in URI form (preferred).

name: orcid_identifier
description: The identifier of the researcher or contributor in ORCID (the ORCID iD). At least one of uri or path must be given. NOTE: this type is also used for legacy client IDs.

fields.name: locale
fields.description: For the up to date supported locale list see https://github.com/ORCID/ORCID-Source/SUPPORTED_LOCALES.md

name: preferences
description: Preferences set by the researcher or contributor. (currently language preference)

fields.name: creation_method
fields.description: The method used to create the ORCID Record * API method - Institution created the record on behalf of the individual * Direct/website methods - Individual registered directly at orcid.org * Member-referred method - Individual registered as part of the OAuth workflow

fields.name: completion_date
fields.description: Only returned on records with a creation method of API, this date is when the user took control of the record and set a password.

fields.name: submission_date
fields.description: The date time when the ORCID record was first created.

fields.name: last_modified_date
fields.description: The date time when the element was last modified.

fields.name: claimed
fields.description: True for all records created via direct/website or member-referred. If the record was created via the API this will be set to True when the user takes control of the record and sets a password.

fields.name: host
fields.description: ORCID host (base URL) of the ORCID iD.

fields.name: path
fields.description: The path is the ORCID iD, section, and put-code and is used when reading the individual item.

fields.name: uri
fields.description: ORCID URI for the ORCID iD.

fields.name: source_client_id
fields.description: The client ID for the client application (Member organization system) that created the item.

fields.name: source_name
fields.description: The human-readable name of the client application (Member organization system) or individual user that created the item. Value for the same person/organization could change over time. source-orcid or source-client-id fields are more appropriate for disambiguated matching.

fields.name: host

fields.name: source
fields.description: The client application (Member organization's system) or user that created the item.

fields.name: deactivation_date
fields.description: The date and time when the ORCID Record was deactivated. (If the account is active, this field will be NULL.)

fields.name: verified_email
fields.description: True if the user has a verified email

fields.name: verified_primary_email
fields.description: True if the user's current primary email is verified

fields.name: visibility
fields.description: Indicates who can see the value of the element when reading the ORCID record. See the enumerations for definitions of each value, private, limited, public, registered-only.

name: history
description: The history of the researcher's ORCID record

fields.description: The date time when the element was last modified.

fields.name: created_date
fields.description: The date time when element was created.

fields.name: last_modified_date
fields.description: The date time when the element was last modified.

fields.name: given_names
fields.description: The given name(s) of the researcher or contributor.

fields.name: family_name
fields.description: The family (last) name of the researcher. This element is optional, because some cultures only use given names.

fields.name: credit_name
fields.description: The full name of the researcher as they prefer it to appear.

fields.description: The disambiguated organization identifier.

fields.name: disambiguated_organization
fields.description: A reference to a disambiguated version the organization to which the researcher or contributor is affiliated. The list of disambiguated organizations come from ORCID partners such as Ringgold, ISNI and FundRef.

fields.name: organization
fields.description: A reference to an organization. An organization should contain a disambiguated organization, which uniquely identifies the organization. While the schema does not enforce the presence of a disambiguated organization, it is only optional for peer review convening organizations. A disambiguated organization is mandatory in all other cases where organization is required in the schema.

fields.name: visibility
fields.description: Indicates who can see the value of the element when reading the ORCID record. See the enumerations for definitions of each value, private, limited, public, registered-only.

fields.name: display_index
fields.description: Display index.

fields.name: path
fields.description: The activity-path attribute is present only when reading elements. It will be of the form /{orcid}/{activity-name}/{put-code} for activity elements or /{orcid}/person/{element-name}/{put-code} for person element

fields.name: department_name
fields.description: Department name.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Organization name.

fields.name: country
fields.description: Country represented by its ISO 3611 code. The visibility attribute (private, limited or public) can be set at record creation, and indicates who can see this section of information.

fields.name: region

fields.name: city
fields.description: City.

fields.name: address
fields.description: Container for address information. Only country information is included at this time.

fields.name: disambiguation_source
fields.description: The source for providing the disambiguated organization ID. For the list of allowed sources see https://github.com/ORCID/ORCID-Source/blob/master/orcid-core/src/main/java/org/orcid/core/orgs/OrgDisambiguatedSourceType.java

fields.name: disambiguated_organization_identifier
fields.description: The disambiguated organization identifier.

fields.name: disambiguated_organization
fields.description: A reference to a disambiguated version the organization to which the researcher or contributor is affiliated. The list of disambiguated organizations come from ORCID partners such as Ringgold, ISNI and FundRef.

fields.name: organization
fields.description: A reference to an organization. An organization should contain a disambiguated organization, which uniquely identifies the organization. While the schema does not enforce the presence of a disambiguated organization, it is only optional for peer review convening organizations. A disambiguated organization is mandatory in all other cases where organization is required in the schema.

fields.name: disambiguation_source
fields.description: The source for providing the disambiguated organization ID. For the list of allowed sources see https://github.com/ORCID/ORCID-Source/blob/master/orcid-core/src/main/java/org/orcid/core/orgs/OrgDisambiguatedSourceType.java

fields.name: disambiguated_organization_identifier
fields.description: The disambiguated organization identifier.

fields.name: disambiguated_organization
fields.description: A reference to a disambiguated version the organization to which the researcher or contributor is affiliated. The list of disambiguated organizations come from ORCID partners such as Ringgold, ISNI and FundRef.

fields.name: organization
fields.description: A reference to an organization. An organization should contain a disambiguated organization, which uniquely identifies the organization. While the schema does not enforce the presence of a disambiguated organization, it is only optional for peer review convening organizations. A disambiguated organization is mandatory in all other cases where organization is required in the schema.

fields.name: type
fields.description:
The type of funding, selected from the following options: * award: Peer-reviewed funding providing direct research costs through competitions * contract: Works commissioned by external public agencies or industry building on research expertise and aimed at deliverables. Include research contracts awarded by federal agencies for both direct and indirect costs, and honoraria * grant: Peer-reviewed funding providing direct research costs through competitions * salary-award: A competitive, peer-reviewed award that is paid as salary to the awardee/faculty member
    		ORCID will validate this value against the enumeration https://github.com/ORCID/orcid-model/blob/master/src/main/java/org/orcid/jaxb/model/common/FundingType.java and other rules when necessary

fields.name: external_id_relationship

ORCID will validate this value against the enumeration https://github.com/ORCID/orcid-model/blob/master/src/main/java/org/orcid/jaxb/model/common/Relationship.java and other rules when necessary.

fields.name: external_id
fields.description: A reference to an external identifier, suitable for works, people and funding. Supported external-id-type values can be found at https://pub.orcid.org/v2.0/identifiers

fields.name: external_ids
fields.description: Container for storing external ids.

fields.description: The date time when element was created.

fields.name: last_modified_date
fields.description: The date time when the element was last modified.

fields.name: host
fields.description: ORCID host (base URL) of the ORCID iD.

fields.name: path
fields.description: ORCID path (16-character identifier) of the ORCID iD.

fields.name: uri
fields.description: ORCID iD in URI form (preferred).

fields.name: source_orcid
fields.description: The identifier of the researcher or contributor in ORCID (the ORCID iD). At least one of uri or path must be given. NOTE: this type is also used for legacy client IDs.

fields.description: ORCID host (base URL) of the ORCID iD.

fields.name: path

fields.name: uri

fields.name: source_client_id
fields.description: The client ID for the client application (Member organization system) that created the item.

fields.name: source_name
fields.description: The human-readable name of the client application (Member organization system) or individual user that created the item. Value for the same person/organization could change over time. source-orcid or source-client-id fields are more appropriate for disambiguated matching.

fields.name: put_code
fields.description: The put-code attribute is present only when reading elements. The code must be used when PUTing (updating) items that contain the attribute (works, affiliations, etc) to ensure that the existing item's history is retained.

fields.name: visibility
fields.description: Indicates who can see the value of the element when reading the ORCID record. See the enumerations for definitions of each value, private, limited, public, registered-only.

fields.name: display_index
fields.description: Display index.

fields.name: path
fields.description: The activity-path attribute is present only when reading elements. It will be of the form /{orcid}/{activity-name}/{put-code} for activity elements or /{orcid}/person/{element-name}/{put-code} for person element

fields.description: Country represented by its ISO 3611 code. The visibility attribute (private, limited or public) can be set at record creation, and indicates who can see this section of information.

fields.name: city
fields.description: City.

fields.description: Container for address information. Only country information is included at this time.

fields.name: disambiguation_source
fields.description: The source for providing the disambiguated organization ID. For the list of allowed sources see https://github.com/ORCID/ORCID-Source/blob/master/orcid-core/src/main/java/org/orcid/core/orgs/OrgDisambiguatedSourceType.java

fields.name: disambiguated_organization_identifier
fields.description: The disambiguated organization identifier.

fields.name: disambiguated_organization
fields.description: A reference to a disambiguated version the organization to which the researcher or contributor is affiliated. The list of disambiguated organizations come from ORCID partners such as Ringgold, ISNI and FundRef.

fields.name: organization
fields.description: A reference to an organization. An organization should contain a disambiguated organization, which uniquely identifies the organization. While the schema does not enforce the presence of a disambiguated organization, it is only optional for peer review convening organizations. A disambiguated organization is mandatory in all other cases where organization is required in the schema.

fields.name: assertion_origin_name
fields.description: The human-readable name of the client application (Member organization system) or individual user that created the item. Value for the same person/organization could change over time. source-orcid or source-client-id fields are more appropriate for disambiguated matching.

fields.name: source
fields.description: The client application (Member organization's system) or user that created the item. XSD VERSION 1.2 UPDATE: the identifier for the source may be either an ORCID iD (representing individuals and legacy client applications) or a Client ID (representing all newer client applications)

fields.name: put_code
fields.description: The put-code attribute is present only when reading elements. The code must be used when PUTing (updating) items that contain the attribute (works, affiliations, etc) to ensure that the existing item's history is retained.

fields.name: visibility
fields.description: Indicates who can see the value of the element when reading the ORCID record. See the enumerations for definitions of each value, private, limited, public, registered-only.

fields.name: display_index
fields.description: Display index.

fields.name: path
fields.description: The activity-path attribute is present only when reading elements. It will be of the form /{orcid}/{activity-name}/{put-code} for activity elements or /{orcid}/person/{element-name}/{put-code} for person element

fields.description: Department name.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Organization name.

fields.name: country
fields.description: Country represented by its ISO 3611 code. The visibility attribute (private, limited or public) can be set at record creation, and indicates who can see this section of information.

fields.name: region
fields.description: Region within a country.

fields.name: city
fields.description: City.

fields.name: address
fields.description: Container for address information. Only country information is included at this time.

fields.name: disambiguation_source
fields.description: The source for providing the disambiguated organization ID. For the list of allowed sources see https://github.com/ORCID/ORCID-Source/blob/master/orcid-core/src/main/java/org/orcid/core/orgs/OrgDisambiguatedSourceType.java

fields.name: disambiguated_organization_identifier
fields.description: The disambiguated organization identifier.

fields.name: disambiguated_organization
fields.description: A reference to a disambiguated version the organization to which the researcher or contributor is affiliated. The list of disambiguated organizations come from ORCID partners such as Ringgold, ISNI and FundRef.

fields.name: organization
fields.description: A reference to an organization. An organization should contain a disambiguated organization, which uniquely identifies the organization. While the schema does not enforce the presence of a disambiguated organization, it is only optional for peer review convening organizations. A disambiguated organization is mandatory in all other cases where organization is required in the schema.

fields.description: The identifier of the researcher or contributor in ORCID (the ORCID iD). At least one of uri or path must be given. NOTE: this type is also used for legacy client IDs.

fields.name: source_name

fields.name: put_code
fields.description: The put-code attribute is present only when reading elements. The code must be used when PUTing (updating) items that contain the attribute (works, affiliations, etc) to ensure that the existing item's history is retained.

fields.name: visibility
fields.description: Indicates who can see the value of the element when reading the ORCID record. See the enumerations for definitions of each value, private, limited, public, registered-only.

fields.name: display_index
fields.description: Display index.

fields.name: path
fields.description: The activity-path attribute is present only when reading elements. It will be of the form /{orcid}/{activity-name}/{put-code} for activity elements or /{orcid}/person/{element-name}/{put-code} for person element

fields.name: disambiguation_source
fields.description: The source for providing the disambiguated organization ID. For the list of allowed sources see https://github.com/ORCID/ORCID-Source/blob/master/orcid-core/src/main/java/org/orcid/core/orgs/OrgDisambiguatedSourceType.java

fields.name: disambiguated_organization_identifier
fields.description: The disambiguated organization identifier.

fields.name: disambiguated_organization
fields.description: A reference to a disambiguated version the organization to which the researcher or contributor is affiliated. The list of disambiguated organizations come from ORCID partners such as Ringgold, ISNI and FundRef.

fields.name: organization
fields.description: A reference to an organization. An organization should contain a disambiguated organization, which uniquely identifies the organization. While the schema does not enforce the presence of a disambiguated organization, it is only optional for peer review convening organizations. A disambiguated organization is mandatory in all other cases where organization is required in the schema.

fields.description: A string that is flagged as transient i.e. populated by ORCID, not the source.

fields.name: error_message
fields.description: Error message.

fields.name: error_code
fields.description: Error code.

fields.name: external_id_normalized_error
fields.description: External id normalized error.

fields.name: external_id_url
fields.description: Represents a URL in the XML anyURI format.

fields.name: external_id_relationship
fields.description: Indicates the relationship type, selected from the following options: part-of, self ,version-of. ORCID will validate this value against the enumeration https://github.com/ORCID/orcid-model/blob/master/src/main/java/org/orcid/jaxb/model/common/Relationship.java and other rules when necessary.

fields.name: external_id
fields.description: A reference to an external identifier, suitable for works, people and funding. Supported external-id-type values can be found at https://pub.orcid.org/v2.0/identifiers

fields.name: external_ids
fields.description: Required when writing work items. The list of supported identifier types is at https://pub.qa.orcid.org/v2.0/identifiers

fields.name: url
fields.description: Represents a URL in the XML anyURI format.

fields.name: type
fields.description: The type of object that the work is, from the list of supported types in https://members.orcid.org/api/resources/work-types ORCID will validate this value against the enumeration https://github.com/ORCID/orcid-model/blob/master/src/main/java/org/orcid/jaxb/model/common/WorkType.java and other rules when necessary

fields.name: year
fields.description: Used with the fuzzy-date type. Represents the year of the date.

fields.name: month
fields.description: Used with the fuzzy-date type. Represents the month of the date.

fields.name: day
fields.description: Used with the fuzzy-date type. Represents the day of the date.

fields.name: publication_date
fields.description: In some places the full date is not required.

fields.name: journal_title
fields.description: The title of the publication or group under which the work was published. * If a journal, include the journal title of the work. * If a book chapter, use the book title. * If a translation or a manual, use the series title. * If a dictionary entry, use the dictionary title. * If a conference poster, abstract or paper, use the conference name.

fields.name: work_summary
fields.description: Work summary.

fields.name: group
fields.description: Work group.

fields.name: path
fields.description: The path is the ORCID iD, section, and put-code and is used when reading the individual item.

fields.name: works
fields.description: Container for the research outputs of the researcher or contributor.

fields.name: path
fields.description: The path is the ORCID iD, section, and put-code and is used when reading the individual item.

name: path
description: The activity-path attribute is present only when reading elements. It will be of the form /{orcid}/{activity-name}/{put-code} for activity elements or /{orcid}/person/{element-name}/{put-code} for person element
